text: Acleris abietana, the Perth button, is a species of moth of the family Tortricidae. It is found in Europe, where it has been recorded from Great Britain, France, Belgium, the Netherlands, Germany, Denmark, Austria, Switzerland, Italy, the Czech Republic, Slovakia, Slovenia, Poland, Hungary and Russia.Fauna Europaea The habitat consists of coniferous woodlands.UKmoths The wingspan is 21–25 mm. Adults are on wing in one generation from August to late October and, after hibernation, from mid-March to May.Lepidoptera of Belgium The larvae feed on Abies alba, Pinus and Picea species (including Picea excelsa and Picea abies). They live in a loose spinning between the needles of their host plant. Larvae can be found from June to July. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1822 abietana Category:Moths of Europe Category:Moths of Russia
title: Acleris abietana
